entry.title: Re: How to know SAP license usage of my company?
entry.content:
You can see an overview of license consumption in SAP4Me in the Customer Insights Dashboard (CID). The CID is located at Home/Reporting/Customer Insights Dashboard >> License Consumption. This view allows you to see consumption at the metric measurement level (e.g. number of form requests). For authorization information to access CID, see KBA 3336856.

Customer Insights Dashboard on the SAP Support Portal

SAP Enterprise Support 

(opens in new tab)

entry.title: Re: Replacemenet of V_WB2_VBRK_VBRP_1 CDS in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi @serap_acar, 

If you want the billing documents considered at the time of Settlement creation for a specific contract, I would recommend to check the table WB2_D_BVDETAIL (used by transaction WB2R_BVDETAIL). 

If you want to retrieve the Billing documents and applying the selection criteria + period of the validity of the contract, indeed CDS view VWB2_VBRKVBRP_1 with data definition V_WB2_VBRK_VBRP_1 for 0S01 contract type or equivalent. 
You can also avoid all the struggle and use the Tcode WB2R_BUSVOL (Fiori tile ID = WB2R_BUSVOL - Display Business Volume - Condition Contracts). 

Regards, 
Gauthier Victor

entry.title: Need to learn skills essential steps for Concur Expense Professional Edition environment?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Getting Started with Concur Expense Professional Edition for Administrators learning journey.

Overview
This learning journey is designed to guide learners through the essential steps for successfully managing the Concur Expense Professional Edition environment as an administrator. It will help develop the skills necessary to ensure a smooth and compliant Expense management experience.

Learning objectives
By the end of this learning journey, learners will be able to:

  • Navigate and confidently manage various aspects of the Concur Expense Professional Edition environment as an administrator.
  • Oversee the entire expense report lifecycle â€” submission, review, approval, and audits to ensure adherence to company policies.
  • Provide practical support to end users.

Prerequisites
Essential:

  • Complete the Getting Started with Concur Expense for Customer Users learning journey before beginning this course.
Furthermore, learners should have
  • A basic understanding of their organizationâ€™s travel and expense policy.
  • Familiarity with general business processes related to expense management.
  • Access to a Concur Expense Professional Edition environment.
  • Basic knowledge of web-based administration tools.

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.
 
Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: SAPFPAYM not triggered automatically after F110 / Manage Automatic Payments
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I am facing an issue with Payment Medium Workbench (PMW) in S/4HANA.
When I run F110 (or Manage Automatic Payments), the payment run finishes successfully, payments are posted, and the payment advice notes are generated.

However, the payment medium file (DME) is not automatically created.
I always need to go to SE38 and run SAPFPAYM manually to generate the payment medium file.

In Manage Payment Media, the status of my items is usually "Downloaded", and I cannot change it to "To Be Generated".

Here are additional details:

  • Payment method is correctly assigned to DMEE format (e.g., FI_PAYMEDIUM_DMEE_CGI_05)

  • Program RFFOAVIS_FPAYM is assigned in the "Printout/Data Medium" tab of the payment method

  • In DME Administration (DMEEADMIN), I can see my file with "Data transmitted to external" checked

  • No DME file is found in AL11 unless I manually run SAPFPAYM

My question:

  • How can I configure F110 so that SAPFPAYM is automatically triggered during the payment run, without having to execute it manually?

  • Do I need to adjust the Payment Medium Workbench (PMW) selection variant, or maintain a missing link in the payment method customizing?

  • Could the status "Downloaded" in Manage Payment Media block the automatic generation?

Any advice or guidance on customizing steps to make SAPFPAYM run automatically after F110 would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: Dynamic Stock Calculation in SAP Datasphere: Handling Non-Cumulative Stock Movements | S/4 IM
entry.content:
Hi Sebastian, very useful blog especially considering that there are not many blogs talking about Non-Cumulative Modelling for Datasphere. ðŸ™‚

I have further questions though, and also to validate my understanding. Just to give you context, we are implementing Datasphere on top of S/4, extracting the Movements and Starting Balance via the standard CDS Views and also need to send the Movements/Stock data to Azure. Both Datasphere and Azure will have their own Reporting (SAC and PowerBI). Hence, my questions are:

  1. If we need to create 'Snapshots' of the Stocks, the only way to do this is to create these 'Custom Non-Cumulative Views' on top of the Movements data. It is not possible to create Snapshots from an Analytical Model with Non-Cumulative modellings/measures. This is mainly because we can't have AMs as a source for Transformation and/or Data Flows (but even if we can there will be performance issues).
  2. You mentioned using Non-Cumulative Modellings/Measures in Analytical Models will have a performance impact, hence your recommendation to build this 'Custom Non-Cumulative View' instead. Do you know the threshold at which there will be a performance impact? i.e. what is your volumes of data? Are you at the granular levels i.e. at Movement Types, Doc Numbers levels?  
  3. For Reporting, do you still combine this Custom Non-Cumulative View into an Analytical Model for use by SAC? And do you still use Non-Cumulative AMs for any other reporting needs/scenarios ? I am trying to ascertain on whether I should still keep both AM and Custom Views, or just use the latter. I would imagine the AM can still be useful, as we can include the Custom View and associate it with the Master Data, before it is 'published' via the AM for SAC. 

Thanks. These Views is also possible to replicate as SQL Scripts doing Non-Cumulative calculations in Azure instead of doing snapshots in Datasphere and sending them over - what are your thoughts?

Thanks. 

Hazlee

entry.title: Re: VBA Error when send a soap request via VBA
entry.content:
Hello @Joey3 ,

The error -2147012852 occurs because the .crt file you're using contains only the public key, but VBA requires a certificate with both a public and private key (typically a .p12 or .pfx file) for mutual TLS authentication.

Possible Solution,

  1. Export the. p12 certificate from your Communication System in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (this includes the private key).
  2. Import it into the Personal Certificate Store on your machine.
  3. In VBA, use. SetClientCertificate() with the full certificate subject that matches the imported .p12.

This ensures the SOAP request can authenticate properly with the backend.

Check below documentations for your references

  • SAP Help â€“ Create Communication Arrangement with Client Certificate
  • SAP Help â€“ Managing Certificates in Communication Systems (Public Cloud)
  • Microsoft â€“ WinHttpRequest.SetClientCertificate method

Let me know if it helps

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: Handling SELECT OPTIONS in CDS using Table Function
entry.content:
@ANA63 hi,

I have also not that much amdp experience but what you could basically do to pass multiple input parameters could be:

-> in your table function define only 'client' as dummy parameter 


write your select logic in your static method
then create an entity which uses this cds table function as data source. It would like something like this :

define view Z_I_XX
  as select from Z_YOUR_TABLE_FUNCTION(
                              client : $session.client) as amdp_source
{
  amdp_source.field1,
  amdp_source.field2,
  amdp_source.field3,
  amdp_source.field4
}

 and in the coding you can pass parameters just like in open sql syntax -> would look like :

SELECT FROM Z_I_XX
   FIELDS field1, field2, field3, field4
   WHERE field3 IN @t_range_field3
     AND field4 IN @t_range_field4
   INTO TABLE @DATA(t_data_via_multiple_parameters):

 havent tried but, it would presumably work.

entry.title: Re: Threshold Compare to Comparison Measure
entry.content:
@egil63 ,

I think comparison on measure is based on % ( 1 over the other). So If Measure 1 is 0.5 and the other Measure is 1 it would be 50%, So may be you need to define in that way. Also In your example Measure 1 - Measure 2 would be negative when Measure 1 is smaller than the Measure 2 which means it Measure 1 would be 0-100% of Measure 2 ( At 100% it would be equal). I think this is what you have defined in red icon. If Measure 1 is bigger than Measure 2 , it will be min 100% of the other measure so it should be 100% to a large value 500% or larger depending on the range you expect 

Nikhil

entry.title: My Home in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 - What's new?
entry.content:
The 2508 release of My Home in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition introduces a range of new delivered and beta features, along with UX enhancements designed to elevate your overall experience. In this blog, Iâ€™ll walk you through these updates and what they mean for you.  

My Home offers immediate access to key business insights, supports efficient management of tasks and situations, and allows you to organize your favorite pages and apps to streamline daily operations. The 2508 release builds on this foundation by further enhancing each of these areas. 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Release My Home

 

One of the standout additions is the new personalized salutation bar, which greets every business user upon entering My Home. This feature not only creates a more personalized experience but also helps users quickly orient themselves within SAP S/4HANA. Now enable communication scenario SAP_COM_0887 and let business users see whatâ€™s next on their calendar at a glance. Additionally, the salutation bar consolidates all of My Homeâ€™s global actions in one convenient placeâ€”it enables users to easily add content, quickly access My Home settings, and discover the latest feature introduced in the 2508 release: Recap. 

My Home Salutation bar

 

The Recap feature introduced in the My Home 2508 release is designed to save time by helping business users stay on top of key items that have emerged since their last login. It highlights high-priority information, enabling users to quickly focus on what matters most. By surfacing relevant updates and simplifying daily tasks, Recap reduces manual effort and helps users catch up efficientlyâ€”so they can shift their attention to higher-value activities. 

My Home Recap Tasks

 

Recap analyzes changes in My Home data over the past 24 hours, keeping business users informed about new tasks, situations, and updates to app, tile, and insights card access. It also provides visual comparisons of insights cards, making it easy to quickly and intuitively understand what has changed during your absence. 

My Home Recap Insights Cards

 

The Salutation Bar also allows business users to easily add content to My Home from a centralized location. But thatâ€™s just the beginningâ€”it now supports AI-assisted content addition, enabling users to add Insights cards using natural language. Users can also preview Insights cards during the addition process to ensure data accuracy and consistency. 

My Home AI-Assisted Adding of Insights Cards

 

With the 2508 release, business users can take advantage of a new Beta AI-assisted Smart Personalization App Addition feature that enables the addition of applications using natural language. This significantly streamlines the process of adding applications, saving time and offering a more intuitive, click-efficient experienceâ€” which is particularly valuable for first-time or occasional users. The feature also enhances transparency by displaying application descriptions and real-time KPIs for dynamic tiles, providing immediate operational context. 

My Home Beta AI-Assisted Adding of Apps and Insights Tiles

 

My Home serves as the central hub for all your tasks, applications, and information. The 2508 release introduces enhancements to the My Home user experience, featuring Recap and AI-Assisted Smart Personalisation. Additionally,  administrators are now empowered to deliver timely, targeted updates directly to business users via the My Home centralized news feed. 

With the addition of the Mange News application, news administrators can create news articles to be displayed on My Home. They can categorize, target and manage the visibility of the news. Tailoring communication to your organisation needs helps create a more informed and connected workforce. This in turn enhances business usersâ€™s performance by equipping them with the information needed to make smarter, faster decisions. 

My Home Manage News Application

 

My Home Manage News Application News article creation

 My Home Critical News Article

 

We hope everyone enjoys the new features of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release â€“ stay tuned for more updates! The Beta AI-assisted Smart Personalization App Addition in My Home, highlighted in this article, is now available for Beta Testing with the 2508 release. At SAP, weâ€™re committed to delivering the best experience possible, which is why weâ€™re inviting you to join our Beta Testing Program. By participating, youâ€™ll get early access to these features, have the chance to share your feedback, and help us fine-tune them before the official launch. Your input will play a key role in shaping the quality and usability of these new capabilities. 

Also, If you are interested in hearing about the latest innovations in SAP Cloud ERP, please join our Public Cloud Practitioner Forum in which SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customers share best practices and provide feedback to the SAP development teams about new functionality. 

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/public-cloud-means-continuous-innovation-and-continuous-learning-new-user/ba-p/14017362 

(Open to SAP Cloud ERP customers, including partners running SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.) 

Caroline Welsh, and Suneet Agarwal  on behalf of the SAP UX Foundations responsible for My Home in SAP S/4HANA.

entry.title: Staying Informed: Key Resources for SAP ERP Human Capital Management Localization in Canada & USA
entry.content:
Localization in SAP ERP Human Capital Management (HCM) is crucial for adapting software to meet specific regional requirements, especially in dynamic markets like Canada and the USA. Whether you're a payroll specialist, implementation consultant, or project manager, staying informed about these changes is vital. Here are some key channels to help you keep up with the latest localization news.

Join SAP Build Work Zones for Localization Insights

SAP Build Work Zones are designed to keep you informed with curated updates and regulatory news specific to your region. By joining these workspaces, you gain access to valuable insights that can help you stay ahead in the ever-evolving landscape of SAP Human Capital Management (HCM) localization.

  • Join the workspace for SAP Human Capital Management Localization for Canada to understand the nuances of SAP HCM tailored for Canadian regulations.
  • Explore the workspace for SAP Human Capital Management Localization for the USA for insights into U.S.-specific compliance and localization features.

Discover the SAP Community for Localization

The SAP Localization Community is your go-to hub for country-specific updates. It offers detailed information on localization capabilities within SAP products, supporting you throughout your journey with SAP localized solutions.

  • Canada Localization Capabilities: Learn about the specific features and updates for SAP products in Canada.
  • USA Localization Capabilities: Get acquainted with the localization features available for SAP products in the USA.

Stay Compliant with Regulatory Change Manager

The regulatory change manager is an essential tool for tracking regulatory changes and their statuses. It helps you stay informed about regulatory changes relevant for your SAP products and business processes, so that you can plan for regulatory compliance from a single source of truth.

  • Access the Regulatory Change Manager for SAP Human Capital Management for Canada to keep track of local regulatory changes in Canada.
  • Connect with the Regulatory Change Manager for SAP Human Capital Management for the USA to stay updated on U.S. compliance requirements.


Call to Action

Stay informed and ahead of the curve by joining the resources mentioned above for SAP ERP HCM localization. Your journey in mastering SAP localization starts here!

Looking forward to our continued collaboration on future posts!

entry.title: The New Table Building Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
With the 2025 Q3 QRC release of SAP Analytics Cloud, weâ€™re excited to introduce the brand-new Table Builder Panel, aligning the table design process closer with that of Charts and Geo Visualizations to streamline story creation.

Within this Blog Post, we will highlight the key analytics enhancements. These are broken down as the following sections:

  1. Ghost Table
  2. New Builder Panel
  3. Functional Enhancements

For planning-related updates with the new Table Builder Panel, see Improved Input Readiness and Unbooked Data Display in SAP Analytics Cloud.

 

Ghost Table

A Ghost Table now appears when a new table is added or enters an error state. For initial creation, it prevents an unnecessary query from being processed and lets designers select the desired object, ensuring a consistent and guided experience. Weâ€™ve also introduced better error handling in the case of cyclic dependencies, missing entities, and so on.

For SAP BW queries, the table automatically inherits the layout, filters, and settings from the underlying query.

 

New Builder Panel

Weâ€™ve introduced a new Builder Panel that aligns the table-building experience with that of Charts and Geo Visualizations. There are several enhancements which include:

  1. Available Object Panel
  2. Flexible Totals and Parent Node Positioning
  3. Improved Drop-Down List for Object Selection
  4. New Member Selector
  5. Table Add-Ons
  6. Single Source for Table Styling

Available Objects Panel

The new Table Builder Panel introduces the option to open the Available Object List, giving visibility into the full structure and objects of the data model. There are a few benefits which include:

  • A smoother, uninterrupted design experience with access to the complete object list
  • Easy addition of objects via drag-and-drop or the more actions icon (i.e. Add to Column or Add to Rows)
  • Clear identification of dimension types through intuitive icons in the object list

 

Flexible Totals and Parent Nodes Positioning

We've transitioned from a centralized "Show Totals and Parent Position" setting to independent controls for the Rows and Columns axes giving Designers greater flexibility to tailor the table layout to their needs.

 

Improved Drop-Down Menu for Object Selection

We've enhanced the selection process for Primary and Secondary Structure Members. Instead of using the Member Selector, users can now select individual members directly from a drop-down menu. The menu has been expanded to span the full width of the Builder Panel, making it easier to locate and select the desired member.

â„¹ï¸Designers can continue to use the Member Selector for more advanced selections for Primary and Secondary Structures.

 

Integration of the New Member Selector

Designers now benefit from the New Member Selector when creating local filters or selecting Primary and Secondary Structures. For Primary and Secondary Structures, a multi-tab layout appears when input controls are detected, simplifying element selection.

Furthermore, support for Primary Structure Filters (Accounts or Measures) has been extended to non-SAP BW models, broadening their applicability.

 

Table Add-Ons

We've improved the discoverability of table add-ons such as In-Cell Chart, Linked Analysis, Hyperlink, and Threshold by introducing a dedicated Add-On section, a consistent experience with Chart and Geographical Visualizations.

A dedicated In-Cell Chart Panel has been introduced, allowing users to configure all In-Cell Chart settings in one place. Options like Show Data Value and Axis Line Color have been moved from the Styling Panel to this new, centralized panel for easier access and a more streamlined design experience.

 

Single Source for Styling

Adaptive Column Width has moved from the Builder Panel, and the Display of Units/Currencies has moved from the Number Formatting to a central location in the Styling Panel under Table Properties.

 

Functional Enhancements

With the new Builder Panel, weâ€™ve introduced several functional enhancements to improve the creation and customization of tabular visualizations. There are several enhancements which include:

  1. Ranking & Sorting Improvements
  2. Report to Report Interface Enhancements
  3. Blended Table Improvements
  4. Flexibility with the Version Dimension
  5. Show / Hide Threshold Tooltip Details
  6. Hierarchal and Multi-Selection Primary Structure Input Control
  7. New Client Calculations Panel

Ranking and Sorting

Weâ€™ve introduced several enhancements to Sort and Rank in Tables, giving users greater flexibility and control.

Sorts in Table are no longer version dependent. When dimensions are placed on both axes, you can now choose to apply sorting to either rows or columns and specify the dimension members to sort. Additionally, Keep Left Columns Group has been renamed to Break Grouping for consistency with chart terminology.

For ranking, Create Top N is now simply Rank to align terminology with charts, with extended capabilities including support for:

  • Ranking across Multiple Dimensions
  • Ranking SAP BW characteristics with collapsed hierarchies

 

Report-Report Interface Enhancements

For SAP BW live connections, the 'Jump To' menu now supports additional targets like Web Dynpro, ABAP reports, and custom BAdIs.

You can also navigate from a wider range of cell types including headers and total cells.

 

Blended Tables

Blended Tables are now supported in the new Builder Panel, with several key improvements:

  • Sort and Rank functionality are now available
  • Description Format (Short, Medium, and Long Text) is supported for SAP BW data
  • Apply Conditions can be used with SAP BW models

âš ï¸Migration of Blended Tables from Classic Experience is not supported and we now require at least one linked dimension within the Table.

 

Flexibility with the Version Dimension

There is now an option to delete the default version filter that is applied to a Table without forcing a single value filter. It provides Planners the flexibility to have the visualization dynamically update to reflect a specific or multiple versions.

It is up to the Story Designer to ensure that the Tables meets at least one of these conditions to display data:

  • The version dimension is added to the Table (i.e. on Rows or Axis)
  • Ensure there is a single value filter on version (via a Local Filter, Story Filter, Page, Filter, or Linked Analysis)
  • Consume a restricted Primary Structure (Account or Measure) or Secondary Structure on version

 

Show / Hide Threshold Tooltip Details

For Thresholds that are shown within the Table, we now provide the flexibility to show the Threshold Tooltip Details. It hides information such as the Threshold, Threshold Name, the Range, and the Bullet Chart.

 

Hierarchal and Multi-Selection Primary Structure Input Control

Weâ€™ve expanded the Primary Structure Input Control to support additional selection types: Multiple Selection, Single Selection Hierarchy, and Multiple Selection Hierarchy. It uses the New Member Selector for a consistent experience.

Tables now support consumption of both Multiple Selection and Multiple Selection Hierarchy input controls, in addition to Single Selection and Single Selection Hierarchy, giving Designers greater flexibility to build dynamic, user-driven tables.

For existing input controls, the current configuration will remain unchanged. However, once edited and confirmed, they will automatically update to the new input control format.

âš ï¸ Charts and Geo visualizations do not support Multiple Selection or Multiple Selection Hierarchy and will return an error if used.

 

New Client Calculations Panel

We've introduced a client-side Calculation Panel to help Designers easily manage calculations used within the Table. Designers can quickly format, edit, or delete a calculation by selecting the corresponding action from the panel.

This release is only the beginning. You can expect ongoing improvements that will make tables more dynamic, interactive, and customizable, pushing the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible within SAP Analytics Cloud. As always, your feedback continues to shape our roadmap, and weâ€™re excited to evolve together as we reimagine how tables can drive decisions and insights across the enterprise.

Stay tuned, thereâ€™s much more to come!

 

SAP Analytics Cloud Documentation on New Table Building Experience

For the full list of current restrictions with the New Table builder, please reference our official documentation.

entry.title: Re: SQL Anywhere SQL central not working after edition upgrade to advanced
entry.content:
It would really help to know which version you were using and what version you upgraded to.

The trace file seems to have a wonky command line. Are you running scjview.exe or a batch file that may have been created with an earlier version.

Try this command:

java -cp "C:\Program Files\SQL Anywhere 17\java\sqlcentral1700.jar;C:\Program Files\SQL Anywhere 17\java\jsyblib1700.jar;C:\Program Files\SQL Anywhere 17\java\SCEditor1700.jar" -Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true -Dsun.java2d.d3d=false -Dsybase.native.executable="C:\Program Files\SQL Anywhere 17\Bin64\scjview.exe" -ea com.sybase.central.viewer.SybaseCentral -installdir="C:\Program Files\SQL Anywhere 17\bin64" -Xmx4096m

Does that launch SQL Central correctly? The SQL Anywhere Java-based tools are meant to be run with the JRE included with SQL Anywhere. From your dump file, it looks like an Oracle JVM is getting in the way.

entry.title: Re: Encrypted CSV, XML files by IRM seem not to be read b...
entry.content:
Hi Wonpyo,

the migration cockpit only accepts files in the defined XML format "XML Spreadsheet 2003". It seems that the decryption corrupts this format. It might be, that you can open this with MS Excel but I guess the header is not the same anymore as the original. The SAP standard methods that the cockpit is using will then not recognize this anymore as a correct XML file of the "XML Spreadsheet 2003" format. The other XML formats are not supported.

You may compare the original XML  template file and the encrypted file via Notepad or Notepad++ compare function. XML is a markup language, means if the differences is only with a corrupted header you may manually correct this header information within Notepad, save it and then upload the file again in Migration Cockpit.

As you are using data from SAP ECC it may made sense to extract the data directly into CSV files using the given target format instead of using the XML files or changing them within Excel.

The advantage of a CSV file is also that you only need to provide the structures/sheets you really need as CSV files and you only need to provide the key fields and the mandatory fields + your needed fields. All other fields that are with no-sense for you, you can remove from the CSV-Header and Data rows. CSV file is then much simpler to handle.

BR

Frank

entry.title: Re: How to use Gemini 2.5 Flash Explicit Context Cache Capability with GenAI Hub SDK
entry.content:
If you are using Google native integration https://help.sap.com/doc/generative-ai-hub-sdk/CLOUD/en-US/_reference/gen_ai_hub.html#google-vertex-ai, then I can see it is based on Google Vertex AI, not Gemini API, so you'd rather need to reference this doc: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/context-cache/context-cache-create

But then I see caches are configured at the Google client level, not model: https://googleapis.github.io/python-genai/genai.html#genai.caches.Caches.create 

So, by looking just at the code, I cannot see how you can program a cache with the Python Genaihub SDK. But it is just me quickly looking into the code without the definitive answer.

Maybe someone from the genAI Hub dev team can share more.

Regards,
--Witalij

entry.title: Partners expand Jouleâ€™s capabilities using custom Joule skills in Joule Studio
entry.content:
In May 2025, SAP announced details about Joule Studio , a new capability within SAP Build for creating custom AI agents and skills powered by agentic AI. This feature allows customers and partners to develop and deploy tailored Joule agents and skills that automate workflows and enhance efficiency across both SAP and non-SAP systems.

To provide early exposure of this innovation to our partner ecosystem, a pilot edition of Hack2Build was launched for creating custom Joule skills. Selected partners received coaching and guidance while gaining access to the pre-General Availability phase of Joule Studio in SAP Build. These partners experimented with crafting custom Joule skills that could handle simpler, rule-based tasks to automate and streamline workflows. In this pilot edition, they were able to orchestrate and trigger these skills based on user intent using natural language inputs and integrate them seamlessly with both SAP and non-SAP systems. 

The Hack2Build initiative began on July 2nd with the selection of 12 partners based on their use case alignment with customer workflow needs, technical viability, expertise, and go-to-market strategies. This cross-functional collaboration involved teams from Joule Studio, SAP Build product engineering, Business AI Partner Management, SAP Industries & Experience, and Partner Ecosystem Success to drive innovations with our partners. The hack phase concluded on July 9th, 2025 with impressive showcases during the demo jam session.

Partners participate in the Hack2Build Pilot edition for custom Joule skills

Recently, SAP announced the general availability of Joule Studio in SAP Build. With Joule Studio  you can extend Jouleâ€™s out-of-the-box capabilities with company-specific skills.

Winners' Podium

During the Demo Jam event at our Hack2Build pilot initiative, an expert panel of judges reviewed each presentation to select four winners. In this post, we will highlight the custom Joule skills developed by these four winning partners, demonstrating their innovation and creativity in leveraging Joule Studio in SAP Build.

Hack2Build custom Joule skills, July 2-9, 2025 : Demo Jam Winners

 

cbs Corporate Business Solutions

AI-Driven Active Monitor (ADAM) designed by cbs simplifies interface monitoring within the SAP Integration Suite by making error messages which are cryptic, clearer and more actionable for IT and business users alike. By leveraging natural language interaction through SAP Joule, ADAM analyzes integration logs using comprehensive SAP knowledge, customer knowledge bases and resolves errors efficiently. The solution can be extended to handle recurring interface issues in Cloud Integration without manual intervention. Utilizing a combination of SAP Build, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model., Python services, and SAP HANA Cloud, ADAM offers real-time support and lowers costs by reducing manual checks and error resolution efforts.

AI-Driven Active Monitor (ADAM) by cbs

EY


EY TrueCost AI leverages custom Joule skills to help finance managers and stakeholders uncover hidden costs affecting profitability, such as rework, scrap or product returns. By analyzing SAP HANA data, it offers insights into indirect costs across procurement, operations, and logistics, empowering teams to proactively manage cost leakages. TrueCost AI combines business context with automation for real-time recommendations aligned with enterprise goals, enhancing decision-making and operational efficiency.

EY's TrueCost AI

 

All for One


All for One created a Joule skills-based maintenance assistant to support field technicians with AI-driven service workflows. Integrated with SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C), the solution enables access to machine data, contract details and service history. Technicians use the All for One Equipment Viewer to identify faulty components, retrieve manuals and machine history through the All for One QuickGen RAG solution as well as initiate part orders via ticket creation. Joule skills support contract information retrieval and approval flows, reducing manual effort. This results in improved first-time fix rates and faster service delivery through a unified interface tailored for technician roles. â€ƒ

â€ƒSodales Solutions

Sodales demonstrated a streamlined incident management solution using custom Joule skills to improve regulatory compliance and enhance user experience. Custom Joule skill automates incident reporting by creating cases in real-time through SAP SuccessFactors HCM with Joule , integrated seamlessly with Sodales application via natural language chat interfaces. Leveraging the SAP Business Technology Platform components like SAP Build Work Zone and SAP HANA Cloud, it enhances operational efficiency for complex labor-intensive environments. By reducing manual input and improving data accuracy, this solution addresses critical incidents swiftly and precisely while laying groundwork for future AI-driven enhancements.

Automated Incident Case Creation by Sodales Solutions

Judges

The panel of judges devoted significant effort to evaluating the Demo Jam event. During this showcase, all the partners presented their custom Joule skills, demonstrating their custom Joule skills innovation and creativity.

  • Christian Pretzsch, Head of Joule, SAP Business AI Product Engineering
  • Hemant Rachh, Senior Director, Product Management, SAP Build
  • Kathrin Hettel, Vice President, Strategic Cross-Portfolio & AI Partnership
  • Pavel Penaz,  Global Vice President & Head of Portfolio - Ecosystem Readiness for SAP Business Suite

Special Thanks 

We extend our appreciation to the SAP team experts from Joule Studio and SAP Build Product Management, Business AI Partner Management, SAP Industries & Experiences and SAP Partner Excellence Center, who coached the partners to successfully develop their solutions during the Hack2Build pilot edition - custom Joule skills initiative. 

Next Phase 

Once Test, Demonstration, and Development Licenses become available, partners expect to complete their full-scope solutions based on experiences gained during the MVP development in the Hackathon phase. The SAP Partner Excellence Center will collaborate with all participating partners to support their journey toward a full-scale build and promote customer adoption.

â€ƒ

entry.title: Re: Say Hi to Joule in SAP Activate road map viewer
entry.content:
Thank you @Cocquerel  for using Joule in the SAP Activate roadmap viewer and for providing your feedback.

We understand you're encountering an issue, and we'd like to help.

Joule automatically defaults to your browser's language. Even if your questions are in English, if your browser's language is set to something else, Joule's responses may not be as expected. Please check that your browser's language or your preferred language in SAP for Me is set to English and try again. You can find instructions on how to change your preferred language in SAP for Me here

Our primary goal is to make Joule accessible to all SAP for Me users and provide quick and simple answers. To achieve this and ensure we can offer it as a free service to a wider audience, we've had to implement a limit on the number of LLM tokens used per question. This may affect the details in some responses. We recommend using the Joule for Consultants feature for more comprehensive and detailed answers. You can learn more about the capabilities of Joule for Consultants on sap.com.

To get more comprehensive answers, we recommend adding more context to your query. For instance, when we rephrased the question to: "I'm an architect starting a new implementation of S/4HANA Cloud Private, what is the purpose of Clean Core Quality Gate 0?â€ Joule provided a more detailed and helpful response.

entry.title: Re: CBC public sector - partner demo activation
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Thank you for reaching out with your questions.

Please note that the PSM Bundle cannot be selected alongside other Bundles, such as the Baseline Accelerator Bundle, Enterprise Management Bundle, or Retail. When creating a workspace, the PSM Bundle can only be selected during the Initial Scoping phase, which occurs before the first deployment to the Target System assigned to the SAP Central Business Configuration Workspace.

Even if you choose to Edit the existing workspace later on, it will not be possible to activate the PSM Bundle given that you already have selected another bundle. Any configurations already made in the workspace will remain unaffected, as the PSM Bundle will not be added retroactively alongside other bundles.

To proceed with the PSM Bundle activation, the recommended approach would be to create a new workspace and assign a new Deployment Target to it. During the creation process, you will have the opportunity to configure the initial settings, such as Country, Language, and Bundle selection, allowing you to select the PSM Bundle for further Business Configuration.

From 2502 the Public Sector Management (PSM) Global scope bundle is available for Austria, Japan, India, Singapore, New Zealand, Belgium, and Switzerland, alongside the existing countries: the US, Germany, Canada, Australia, the Netherlands, and the United Kingdom. 

For additional guidance, you can reach out for these related information:

  • Bundle | SAP Help Portal
  • Creating a new Workspace | SAP Help Portal
  • SAP Central Business Configuration | SAP Help Portal
  • Get Started Quickly with SAP Central Business Conf... - SAP Community
  • 3477477 - Availability of Public Sector Management (PSM_Global bundle) Scope items

I hope this clarifies your questions.

Best Regards,

Marcelo

entry.title: Improved Input Readiness and Unbooked Data Display in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Challenges with Traditional Unbooked Planning Tables

In current planning tables using unbooked mode, all combinations of dimension members are shown even if some combinations are not plannable:

  • The combination being invalid due to validation rules
  • The user lacking write access to the members
  • The combination being locked by data locking

And the non-writeable cells due to data security arenâ€™t shown as read-only.

As a result, planners often face large and complex tables with full member combinations. This increases the chance of mistakenly entering data into non-plannable cells, leading to errors or incorrect disaggregation, and creating confusion, wasted effort and planning inaccuracies.

 

The Improved Input Readiness and Unbooked Data Display

With the QRC3 2025 release in SAP Analytics Cloud, there are a few significant improvements to input readiness and the display of unbooked data, making planning more intuitive and efficient.

  • Planners gain clear guidance on where they can plan data
  • Story designers benefit from simplified configurations.

Note:  these new capabilities require opting in to the new table build experience.  See this blog for more details about the new table build experience.

 

Key Capabilities

Visualized Locking for Input Readiness: Cells that are locked by data access control automatically appear as input-disabled. Planners no long guess where to enter data. The optional â€œReasons for Unplannable Dataâ€ helps explain the cell is input-disabled because the user is lacking write access.

Safe and Secure Data Disaggregation: when your model has data access control, values entered at a parent node are disaggregated only to leaf nodes where planning is allowed.

Note: Input Readiness and Disaggregation now fully support:

  • Validation rule
  • Data locking
  • Data access control (new in the QRC3 2025 release)

Cleaner Views with Hiding of Unplannable Unbooked Rows/Columns: Rows and columns where all cells are unbooked and input-disabled (due to validation rule or data access control) are automatically hidden. It gives planners a cleaner and more focused view.  

Note: in the QRC3 2025 release, the unbooked rows/columns locked only by data locking are not hidden.

Unified and Simplified Planning Security Settings:  In the table design panel:

  • Data disaggregation and input enablement settings are now managed with a single toggle, making configuration faster and less error prone.   
  • Story designers can enforce or ignore individual planning security types: data access control, validation rule and data locking - enabling full flexibility to design different scenarios or simulate planning.

 

Explore With Examples

Assume your model has:

  1. Data access control: You can write to â€œCanadaâ€ and â€œMexicoâ€, but â€œUSAâ€ is read-only.
  2. Validation rule: Product â€œP1â€ is valid for â€œCanadaâ€, and Product â€œP2â€ is valid for â€œUSAâ€ and â€œMexicoâ€

Combination

Plannable?

 

P1 + Canada

âœ…Yes

Valid combination and write access

P1 + Mexico

âŒNo

Invalid combination and write access

P1 + USA

âŒNo

Invalid combination and no write access

P2 + Canada

âŒNo

Invalid combination and write access

P2 + USA

âŒNo

Valid combination but no write access

P2 + Mexico

âœ…Yes

Valid combination and write access

 

Prerequisite: your story uses the new table build experience, which you can enable by clicking â€œSwitch All Tables to New Build Experienceâ€ to opt in.

Input Readiness Enhancements based on Data Access Control and Validation Rule

With the QRC3 2025 release, input readiness now respects data access control, in addition to validation rule and data locking.

The cell (P1 + USA) is shown as unplannable, with both reasons explained.

The cell (â€œP1â€, â€œCanadaâ€) is plannable and input-ready.

You no longer need to add every dimension involved in validation rules to the table. If a dimension used in validation rule is not in the table nor filters, itâ€™s treated as if all members are selected.

Any filter applied to a dimension involved in validation rule or data access control is automatically taken in account when determining input readiness, which boosts the accuracy of input readiness. For example,

  • When all 3 regions are selected in the filter, its parent â€œNorth Americaâ€ stays input-enabled because it has at least an eligible child â€œCanadaâ€.

  • When only â€œUSAâ€ (without write access) is selected in the filter, â€œNorth Americaâ€ becomes input-disabled because all its children in the table are now input-disabled.

 

Data Disaggregation based on Data Access Control

In the model preference, a new toggle - â€œDisaggregated on Data Access Controlâ€ - is available.  

  • Turned on by default for newly created models.
  • Turned off by default for existing models to preserve current behavior. 
  • You can turn it on or off manually, depending on your needs.

When this toggle is turned on, values entered at a parent node are disaggregated only to leaf nodes with write access. In the example above, write access is granted to â€œCanadaâ€ and â€œMexicoâ€ but â€œP1 + Mexicoâ€ is invalid due to validation rule. Therefore, the data is disaggregation to â€œP1 + Canadaâ€ where write access is permitted and the combination is valid.

 

Auto-Hiding of Unplannable Unbooked Rows/Columns

In the table design panel, a new table configuration â€“ â€œHide Unplannable Unbooked Dataâ€ â€“ is available.

When this configuration option is turned on,

  • Entire rows or columns containing only unbooked and input-disabled cells (due to validation rule or data access control) are automatically hidden.
  • This creates a cleaner and more focused table, allowing users to focus on plannable cells.

In the example above, only â€œP1 + Canadaâ€ and â€œP2 + Mexicoâ€ cells are plannable due to validation rule and data access control. Other rows that are unplannable and unbooked are hidden. 

Note: in the QRC3 2025 release, the unbooked rows/columns locked only by data locking are not hidden.

The input -disabled but booked cells remain visible in the table as they contribute to the parent level aggregation.  In this example, you have read access to â€œUSAâ€, so the â€œUSAâ€ row is displayed but locked. Other rows that are unplannable and unbooked are hidden.

 

 

Simplified and Harmonized Table Settings for Planning Security

In the table design panel, story designers can now decide whether to enable or ignore planning security.

  • When enabled:
    • Cells that are locked by data locking, validation rule or data access control appear as readonly. 
    • Data disaggregation respects model disaggregation settings.
  • When disabled:
    • Cells are input-enabled and values are disaggregated to all leaf nodes.

 

Conclusion

With these new capabilities, planners are empowered to work more confidently and efficiently, while ensuring consistency and accuracy.

  • Improved input readiness
  • Data disaggregation respecting data access control, validation rule and data locking
  • Cleaner and focused table views, automatically hiding all unplannable unbooked rows and columns
  • Simplified configuration for story designers

entry.title: Beginners Guide to Advanced Event Mesh
entry.content:
Introduction:

In this blog post, I will show the common scenarios of Advanced Event Mesh. To get familiar with basic concepts, go through the below links as a prerequisite.

Advanced Event Mesh: Basic Concepts 

Advanced Event Mesh: Create your first event broker

Advanced Event Mesh: Queue 

Advanced event mesh is powered by Solace and throughout the blog post I will use a solace trial account. All the steps remain same if you are using AEM (Advanced Event Mesh).

In this blog post, the following topics will be covered.

  • Publish Message to Queue using AEM adapter
  • Consume Message from Queue using AEM adapter
  • DMQ Setup and Error Handling
  • Direct Message
  • Durable topic endpoint
  • Use of Selector
  • Send NACK to Publisher
  • Time-to-Live
  •  Rest Delivery Point
  • Replay Log
  • Parallel Consumers
  • Request Reply Pattern

Scenario 1: Publish Message to Queue using AEM adapter

Step 1: 

Create a queue in AEM

Step 2:

Create an iFlow

 

Configure HTTP sender adapter

Configure AEM receiver adapter. Here, the password secure alias is of type Secure Parameter.

The queue name is populated based on the value of Camel header - CamelHttpPath

The message is set as DMQ eligible.

Step 3:

Send event message using API testing tool to the endpoint: https://<host>/http/generic/order

 

Step 4:

Validate if the message is pushed to the AEM queue

Scenario 2: Consume Message from Queue using AEM adapter

Step 1:

Create an iFlow to consumer message from the AEM queue. Set Allowed headers as * to trace the incoming headers.

Configure AEM sender channel

Step 2:

Check message trace in Cloud Integration and verfiy headers. As the publisher iFlow set the the header DMQ eligible as true, the 'IsDMQEligible' header is true.

Step 3:

Verify the consumer status attached to the AEM queue.  Here, it reflects 'Messages Confimed Delivered' as 1.

Scenario 3: DMQ Setup and Error Handling

To move a message to DEAD Message queue upon delivery failure, follow the steps below.

Step 1:

Configure AEM queue as below.

Also, the queue is subscribed to the topic expression order/>

 

Step 2:

 

Change receiver channel configuration in order to push event message to a topic. The topic name is dynamically set using the header - CamelHttpPath .
 

The sender channel will consume messages from the queue named â€˜orderâ€™. The message sent from the publisher iFlow is a JSON message. In order to simulate failure, XML to JSON converter block is added . 

Notice the acknowledgement mode is 'Automatic Immediate' at Cloud Integration (Consumer).
 
 

Step 3:

POST message to the endpoint https://<host>/http/generic/order. No message will be pushed to the queue, because the topic subscription order/> expects at least one level after order.

 

 

Step 4:

 

Push message to the endpoint https://<host>/http/generic/order/create
 
 
But, observe the message is successfully deleted from the queue. It is because acknowledgment mode is 'automatic immediate'.
 
 
Now, the retry happens in Cloud Integration 4 times and then the message is marked as failed. 
 
The below shows the trace of Run 1. The header 'DeliveryCount' is set from AEM. The header 'LocalProcessingAttempt' refers to processing attempts at Cloud Integration.
 
 
At run 5,  LocalProcessingAttempt value will be 5. After run 5, the message moves to failed state, as the maximum message processing attempts is set as 5.

Step 5:

Now, change the acknowledge mode to 'Automatic on Exchange Complete'.

Trigger the event message from API testing tool. After trigger, the message is still in the queue, while retry is going on at Cloud Integration.

Now, after 4 retries, in Cloud Integration, failed status is sent back to the AEM. 

During the 5th run, we can see the local processing attempt as 5.

As we have provided, the re-delivery count as 3 in AEM, the AEM re-delivers it 3 times.

Below shows 1st re-delivery i.e, 2nd delivery from AEM (Run 5 at Cloud Integration)

3rd re-delivery from AEM (Run 5 at Cloud Integration)

 

Then the message is moved to DMQ (Dead Message Queue). Please note, the DMQ queue must be created beforehand. DMQs are not automatically created during message failure.

 

Scenario 4: Direct Message

For direct message, if we use topic, no queue or topic endpoint configuration is required at AEM. If consumer is available during publishing of message, the message will be consumed, else the message will be lost.

Step 1:

Configure Publisher iFlow.

Step 2:

Configure Consumer iFlow.

Step 3:

Test and validate.

Scenario 5: Durable topic endpoint

Step 1:

Create a topic endpoint at AEM.

Step 2:

Configure the AEM receiver adapter which acts as a publisher.

Configure the AEM sender adapter which acts as a subscriber.

Durable Topic endpoint supports a single subscription. Once a consumer is attached, the topic name gets populated.

Now, currently the topic endpoint has 2 messages queued.

Step 3:

Change the topic name at Cloud Integration side to 'product/create'.

After changing the topic name to 'product/create' and deploying the consumer iFlow, all existing messages are deleted automatically without delivering it to the consumer and the recent topic name gets reflected.

Scenario 6: Use of Selector

Step 1:

Configure Publisher iFlow as below.

 Set event type, priorty and status as user properties.

Step 2:

Populate the selector field at AEM sender adapter as below.

 

Step 3:

Test with payload field values as below:

data/eventTypeorder.updated
data/statusdelayed
data/priorityhigh

Check the trace of consumed message at Cloud Integration.

Now, test with payload field values as below:

data/eventTypeorder.updated
data/priorityhigh

The message is not consumed from the queue as the selector does not match.

Scenario 7: Send NACK to Publisher

General behavior is 

  • If topic subscription does not exist for delivery mode persisted(guaranteed) or direct, no error response is sent to the publisher
  • If queue does not exist for delivery mode persisted(guaranteed), error response is sent to the publisher

  • If the queue does not exist for delivery mode direct, no error response is sent to the publisher.

The profile related to used client username (solace-cloud-client) is 'default' at AEM.

 Go to 'default' profile at AEM.

After 'Reject Messages to Sender On No Subscription Match Discard' is enabled, if no matching topic subscription is found for persistent delivery mode, an error message is returned to the publisher.

Now, if we stop the incoming calls to the queue,

we will get the error message as below.

 

Now, we change the property 'Reject Messages to Sender on Discard' on the queue to â€˜Alwaysâ€™,

we will get the error message as below,

Scenario 8: TTL (Time to Live) 

Enable TTL feature of queue at AEM.

If the message is not consumed, the message will be moved to DMQ after 1 min. Here, no TTL specific settings are configured in the receiver channel at Cloud Integration.

If we donâ€™t want to store it in the DMQ and discard the message after TTL, set DMQ eligible to false at publisher iFlow.

After TTL, the stats will reflect the same at AEM.

If TTL is set at receiver adapter, the minimum of the queue level TTL and the publisher level TTL takes effect.

 

Scenario 9: RDP (REST Delivery Point)

We have a common DMQ queue for all processes and the Rest Delivery points to Cloud Integration endpoint. Based on the endpoint, Cloud Integration forwards it for relevant processing of the DMQ messages.

Business ObjectEndpoint
Business Partnerredeliver/businesspartner/<BPNumber>
Orderredeliver/order/<OrderNumber>

Step 1:

Design the publisher iFlow as below.

User Property named â€˜identifierâ€™ is added in AEM receiver adapter.

Step 2:

Create RDP at AEM.

Create Rest Consumer with authentication type â€˜OAuth2â€™ for Cloud Integration

Bind the AEM queue to the RDP endpoint.

On the queue bindings settings, turn on the 'Substitution Expressions' for 'Request Target Evaluation'. The below substitution expression is used for target endpoint genertion. The expression ${topic(1)} represents the 1st level of the topic.

/http/redeliver/${topic(1)}/${userPropertyAsString("identifier")}

In case of failure at RDP, it retries forever unless we disable 'Try Forever' and set 'Maximum Redelivery Count' at DMQ.

Step 3:

The generated endpoint for order message is shown below:

The generated endpoint for business partner message is shown below:

 

Scenario 10: Replay Log

If replay log is enabled, the messages can be replayed from Broker without publisher intervention. To avoid saving the log for all queues, we can enable logging based on topic subscription.

For example, the consumer 'Cloud Integration' forwards message to a target but the target system is down. All the messages from that point need to be replayed. For that, we need a start pointer and 'ReplicationGroupMessageId' can be used. As a pre-requisite, replication group message id for each message should be logged as a custom header at Cloud Integration.

Now, replay all the messages after the above replication group message id. Please note that selective replay of messages or providing an end replication group message id is not possible. Therefore, idempotency must be implemented on the target side to avoid processing duplicate messages.

Messages after Replication Group Message ID will be replayed.

Similarly, we can create a new queue and attach it to a new consumer and replay the previous log related to its topic subscription from the beginning or from a particular date and time or based on replication group message id.

Scenario 11: Parallel Consumers

No. of consumers = (no. of worker node) * (no. of parallel consumer).

If the tenant has 2 worker nodes and 1 parallel consumer, the consumer attached the queue will show up as below:

If we increase the parallel consumer to 5,

the consumer count becomes 10.

Only 1 consumer is active, the remaining 9 consumers are in inactive state. This is because the queue type is 'Exclusive'.

Now, if we change the queue type to â€˜Non-Exclusiveâ€™,

 all the consumers are active. 

E.g., if we want a particular object id (say Business Partner) to be processed by the same consumer, we can utilize the partition concept.

Set the partition count as 5.

Set the parallel consumers as 3

As the tenant has 2 worker nodes, the total no. of consumer will show up as 6. Only 1 consumer is inactive. Remaining consumers are in active state as the number of partition count is 5.

If we set 'JMSXGroupID' value, it will be used as a partition key. 

For example, for BP number '10001234', the message was consumed by Flow ID 248 and for BP number '10001236', it was consumed by Flow ID 281.

All the updates related to BP '10001236', are lined up for the same consumer.

Scenario 12: Request Reply Pattern

The publisher iFlow is designed as below:

Configure the AEM receiver channel as below. 

This will create a non-durable queue at AEM when the message is sent from publisher iFlow.

Consumer iFlow receives the headers populated from Publisher iFlow related to response propagation, such as ReplyToDestination, ReplyToEndpointType and CorrelationId

Design Consumer iFlow as below

Please note: The delay is used here only to simulate processing time instead of adding additional pallets. 

AEM receiver adapter is used to send back the response.

After 'request-reply' step in the publisher iFlow message trace, we will see the response headers.

 

Lets test the publisher iFlow.

As we can see, the response message is received.

Thank you for reading this blog post.

entry.title: Executing Multiple Promotion Actions Simultaneously
entry.content:
Is it possible to create a single promotion that, when triggered, executes the actions of two different promotions simultaneously?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Executing Multiple Promotion Actions Simultaneously
entry.content:
You want to create a single promotion that triggers the actions of two different promotions simultaneously.

Here are a few suggestions for you:

1. Simplify the setup by combining the actions into one promotion

For example:

Promotion01

  • Condition: Buy 1 product

  • Action 1: Free Gift

  • Action 2: Fixed Discount on Cart

You can combine multiple actions within one promotion when the condition is met.

2. Create two separate promotions with the same condition

For example:

  • Promotion 1:

    • Condition: Product 1

    • Action: Free Gift

  • Promotion 2:

    • Condition: Product 1

    • Action: Fixed Discount on Cart

When the customer buys Product 1, which is the condition for both promotions, both actions will apply to the cart if you use a non-exclusive rule group.
Iâ€™ll share the documentation below for your reference.

  • Rule Groups
  • Exclusive vs. Non-Exclusive Rule Groups

entry.title: /IBP/SOURCELOCATION_ATTRÂ and /IBP/TLANE_EXT extracting TINVALID flag incorrectly
entry.content:
All,

/IBP/TLANE_EXT is housing data for a Location Sources AKA Source Locations being sent to IBP via CPI-DS.

Location Sources via Extractors | SAP Help Portal

The CI-DS tool is taking data out of the extractor /IBP/SOURCELOCATION_ATTR and doing some light ETL to load it into SAP IBP. For some material/plan/ship-from combinations the TINVALID flag is being set to â€œXâ€ even though there are valid PIRâ€™s for those combinations.

Iâ€™ve set up some trouble shooting dataflows since we are modifying the TINVALID flag in the ETL based on some additional logic. However, unmodified TINVALID value is â€œXâ€ for these seemingly valid combinations. Additionally, according to the SAP documentation in the link above, the TINVALID flag corresponds to the LOEKZ value in /IBP/TLANE_EXT. However, the combinations are not marked for deletion in that table or in the PIR tables (EINE/EINA).

My first screenshot shows the csv I extracted, in that you will see, TINVALID_1 as X, this is a raw copy of the TINVALID value from the /IBP/SOURCELOCATION_ATTR structure. The other value is value after it had the existing ETL on it. The 2nd screenshot shows the records from the /IBP/TLANE_EXT table in their raw form in production (OPE500).

I have checked the underlying source list, purchasing info record, and MARC data. None of those are marked for deletion for this data, and none of which appear to have any status that would seem to indicate the product is inactive.

Has anyone else come across this issue when using standard IBP extractors in ECC? Is any transformation of the data in /IBP/TLANE_EXT into the /IBP/SOURCELATION_ATTR structure in the standard SAP code? And if so, is there specific coding around plant to plant transfers?
